args: And now you've taken me to the kitchen?
I have! Folks are terrifically busy making\ntreats in here, and you should help out.
This seems more your style than pranking,\ndon't you think?
Consider this another part of your studies.\nGo on now! Lend a hand!
Er, hello, Sylas. Did you need something?
As you can see, sir, we are quite occupied\nat the moment, so please make whatever\nbusiness you have with us brief.
Right, well, I was hoping to help you\nmake some of these treats. Er, I think?
That would be most appreciated.\nCome this way.
So then, what would you like me to make?\nPumpkin cookies? Perhaps some tarts?
No, sir. I would like you to make...this!
Indeed, this Flesh-of-the-Damned Cake\nwith Bloody Sauce is a Halidom special.
Oh, and though they look like fingers,\nI guarantee they are merely sweets.\nThere is no cause for alarm.
But won't this specialty of yours cause\npeople to lose their appetites?
Not on Halloween, sir. Despite the morbid\nappearance, they're actually quite popular.
Here is the recipe—do not forget the\nstrawberry sauce for the blood at the end.\nBest of luck.
Heh heh heh! What a fun surprise, no?
Anyone would be shocked to be served\nsevered fingers on a plate.
I never thought something I loved could\nbe cooked into something so...morbid.
Oh, but seeing someone as cool and\ncollected as you be surprised IS a delight!
It reminds me of long ago...
I once had a grandson who loved\nstrawberries and was easily frightened,\nmuch like yourself.
While I love strawberries, I am no coward.
Are you sure? I have my doubts after\nseeing your reaction to the fingers!
Please, sir. Less talking and more working.
R-right! Apologies! ...Although I wonder\nwhy I'm the only one in trouble here.
No one would count an old man like me\nas any kind of assistant.
Is that really all there is to it?
(Come to think of it, neither Cleo nor\nEdward mentioned the doctor.)
(It's unthinkable that they wouldn't greet\na guest. Were they truly so busy that they\noverlooked him?)
Apologies, madam! I was deep in thought.\nAre you all right?
Yes, it's me! You were treating me with\nyour aromatics up until last month!
Thanks to you, I've been able to sleep\nagain and I'm fit as a fiddle!
I'm glad your insomnia has cleared up\nand you no longer have those deep bags\nunder your eyes.
Right?! Now I can even dress up and\ncome to fine parties like this one!
Oh, shoot! I was going to get another\npumpkin. See you again soon, Sylas!
I'm starting to get the impression that\nenjoying Halloween has nothing to do\nwith creating a healing aromatic.
I met you the same day I was unable\nto help my patient.
Is all this just a ploy to raise my spirits\nafter that loss?
If so, I appreciate the consideration,\nbut do not require it.

I was not lying when I said that enjoying
the Halloween season would help you
discover the essence of the healing
aromatic you seek.
Then please, tell me what Halloween has\nto do with—
Oh, look! It's the nice guy with\nall the smelly stuff!
It's been some time, Mister Sylas.\nHave you been keeping well?
You're the daughter of the woman\nwho loved those yellow flowers.
Yes, and you helped us so much back then.
Oh, please don't look so sad.
Your aromatics saved us. They saved\nme, my daughter, AND my mother.
I...I see. I am glad to hear it.
Where are you going? You made all those\ncakes and then bolted out of there!
I'm going back to my room. I don't have\ntime to play around with whatever this\nis anymore.
People suffer while I'm out gallivanting\naround kitchens and whatnot, and I will\nnot stand for it.
I must finish my healing aroma as soon\nas possible for their sakes.
And how much progress will you make\nwhen you're all worked up like this, mmm?
It doesn't matter. I must do this.
There are so many patients who could have\nbeen saved by now had I merely perfected\nmy recipe!
So much time has passed since I began\nmy research, and yet I'm no closer to a\nsolution than when I started.
I had no right to face those two.\nHad I the healing aromatic, that woman's\nmother would yet live.
You're spiraling, my boy. Snap out of it.
Those two have moved on. What use is\nit to anyone if you refuse to do the same?
They came and showed you gratitude.\nWould you really cast that aside?
...I will be returning to my room now.\nThank you for all you have taught me.
Just as stubborn as he always was...
